reference.title: apiSyntax
reference.shortdesc: The <apiSyntax> element provides the representation in the programming language for the declared interface for the API item.

section.title: Description
section.p: In the <apiDef> element, the <apiSyntax> element can supplement or replace the semantic declaration of the same interface. When a specialization provides a complete representation of the interface within a specialized <apiDef> element, it can omit the <apiSyntax> element. The Java API reference takes this approach.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following example shows an <apiSyntax> element for a Visual Basic property:
